items.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek
items.content_html: U.S. stocks were mostly lower, with the Nasdaq leading declines as makers of AI infrastructure suffered steep falls, many in the double digits. Nvidia was down 16%.
items.content_text: U.S. stocks were mostly lower, with the Nasdaq leading declines as makers of AI infrastructure suffered steep falls, many in the double digits. Nvidia was down 16%.

items.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
items.content_html: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

items.title: Arabica Coffee Prices Hit Record on U.S., Colombia Tariff Spat
items.content_html: Arabica coffee prices hit a record level, as traders digested the withdrawal of President Trump’s threats to impose tariffs and economic sanctions on Colombia.

items.title: Swiss franc, Japanese yen Rise as DeepSeek News Boosts Safe Havens
items.content_html: The Yen and Swiss Franc were stronger against the dollar as investors sought safe havens after Chinese start-up DeepSeek’s new AI model hit U.S. tech stocks.

items.title: Natural Gas Falls on Shifting Weather Forecasts
items.content_html: U.S. natural gas futures fell after weekend updates took some of the chill out of early February weather forecasts.

items.title: U.S. Treasury Yields Fall But Direction for Long-End Yields Still Seen Upward
items.content_html: The 10-year U.S. Treasury yield fell and ING said the the long end of the Treasury curve will continue trading at higher yields even as Trump hasn’t delivered anything to shock markets so far.

items.title: Russia's Crude Exports Fairly Stable Despite U.S. Sanctions, Goldman Says
items.content_html: Oil edged lower in early trade as Goldman Sachs said the latest round of U.S. sanctions against Russia haven’t had a significant impact on the country’s oil exports.
